text.p: The shares of stockbrokerage Rashid Hussein Bhd and its banking subsidiary DCB have been suspended pending an announcement, the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange said on Monday.

Rumours about a restructuring that would see Rashid Hussein -- which owns a controlling 20 percent stake in DCB Bank's parent DCB Holdings Bhd -- being taken over by DCB bank -- have been circulating in the market for weeks.
Rashid's chairman Abdul Rashid Hussain said recently the company was open to merger proposals with other banks or a tie-up with a foreign bank.
But he told reporters on October 4: "There are no formal proposals being made."
Rashid shares were last traded at 15.80 ringgit, and DCB at 8.65.
